name: 1.0 ASPHALT CONSTRUCTION INSPECTION AND TEST PLAN
Detail of Activity - Obtain necessary Consents and Permits, and ensure differet lines of information are aligned
Acceptance Criteria - Items in checklist completed or send out for action
Detail of Activity - Confirm ITP items for underlying works have got confirmation and sign off received from client
Frequency - Per site prior to commencement
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - Project Specification
Verification Record Documents - Copy of signed ITP
Detail of Activity - Ensure that the design is approved and drawings are of the latest revision
Frequency - Prior to commencement and as required for revisions during the works
Acceptance Criteria - Design document with principal approval signature
Detail of Activity - Quality plan for the site that looks at site specific requirements
Acceptance Criteria - RQP with principal approval signature
Detail of Activity - Confirm compliant Mix design is in place
Frequency - Prior to commencement with revision uploaded when it reaches expiry date; per mixtype and plant
Acceptance Criteria - Dates valid and performance aligns with requirements SMA12.5 PG64V, AC20 PG64V
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10 & M27 Mix design report submitted to NZTA
Comments/ Verification - Approval of Contract Administrator &/or Design Engineer
Detail of Activity - Confirmation of compliant materials used in mix
Frequency - Prior to commencement with revision uploaded when it reaches expiry date; per mixtype and asphalt plant
Acceptance Criteria - IANZ accredited test reports that meet relevant specification
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - M01 - A NZTA M10: 2020: sec 2
Comments/ Verification - All individual test reports need to be available for review by client as requested
Detail of Activity - review lay down trial records
Frequency - Prior to commencement per mix
Acceptance Criteria - Mix design results achieved
Detail of Activity - Binder and Grading Testing - Particle Size Distribution and Binder Content
Frequency - Minimum of 1 test for every 200T produced, per mixtype and asphalt plant
Inspection / Test method - Field / Lab Testing
Acceptance Criteria - For individual tests: 1.18mm sieve and larger: ±8
For mean of 3 tests: 1.18mm sieve and larger: ±5 0.
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 2020: 5.1-5.3 ; M27
Verification Record Documents - IANZ accredited test report
Comments/ Verification - When 3 or more tests are required for a project a rolling average can be calcuated.
○ Tolerances are the maximum allowable on the JMF.
Detail of Activity - Volumetrics Testing - Maximimum Specific Gravity and Airvoids
Frequency - Minimum 1 test for every 600Tproduced, per mixtype and asphalt plant
Inspection / Test method - Field / Lab Testing
Acceptance Criteria - For individual tests: Binder content, percent by mass: ±0.5 Air voids: +2,-1
○ For mean of 3 tests: Binder content, percent by mass: ±0.3 Air voids: +1.2,-0.6
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 2020: 5.1-5.3 ; M27
Verification Record Documents - IANZ accredited test report
Comments/ Verification - When 3 or more tests are required for a project a rolling average can be calcuated.
○ Tolerances are the maximum allowable on the JMF.
Detail of Activity - Ensure everything is in place for works to go ahead and outstanding Items from contractor checklist have been actioned
Acceptance Criteria - Complete Pre AC construction site checklist
Verification Record Documents - Pre AC construction site checklist attached
Detail of Activity - Ensure everything is in place and all outstanding items and previous holdpoints have been actioned or released.
Acceptance Criteria - Complete go/no go checklist
Verification Record Documents - Complete go/no go checklist
Detail of Activity - The existing road surface and underlying pavement shall be milled to the specified AC depth and area covered
Frequency - 20m left right and centre behind the milling machine
Verification Record Documents - stringline sheet from QA pack
Comments/ Verification - dipchecks behind the mill can be completed instead or in addition to stringlines
Detail of Activity - Proofrolling to be done on milled surface
○ Use PTR or loaded Asphalt truck, to proofrol milled area's. If it shows movement or has loose material please contact renewals or cotracts manager.
Acceptance Criteria - Surface finish shall present a tightly consolidated surface after sweeping.
Verification Record Documents - Pictures or video
○ Written communication if any additional instructions received
Detail of Activity - G4 or 5 Memberane
Frequency - Prior to paving on exposed Sub Base
Acceptance Criteria - 1.0 l/m² residual binder minimum
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 9.3.2;
Verification Record Documents - Spraysheet with RP's and pictures for verification
Comments/ Verification - Looks for stripping or any other damages.
○ Spray vertical faces and transverse joints as well.
Detail of Activity - An emulsion tack coat must be sprayed between all Asphalt Layers.
Frequency - Prior to paving on top of existing Asphalt layer
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 9.3.1;
Verification Record Documents - Spraysheet(s) or pictures for verification
Comments/ Verification - Spray vertical faces and transverse joints as well

Detail of Activity - Transverse joints to be milled/cut back to provide a square edge and emulsion must be handsprayed on the vertical face. Succesive transverse joints must be staggered by a minimum of 2m
Verification Record Documents - Pictures for verification
Detail of Activity - Delivery and compaction temperatures to be monitored throughout the paving process
Frequency - Each truckload that arrives on site prior to paving
Acceptance Criteria - A minimum of -30 degrees from the recommended mixing temperature of 160-175°C To be recorded when mix is tipped into the paver.
○ Manager to be notified if temperature falls below: AC20 PG64V 130°C
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 2020: Notes; Higgins asphalt bitumen guide, NZTA M1A 2019
Verification Record Documents - Mix tracking sheet from QA pack; contains delivery temperature, temp when in paver, temp inside the screed and rolling temp on AC
Comments/ Verification - It is critical to ensure a temperature representative of the full load and not surface temperatures of the mix are measured.
Detail of Activity - Monitor layer thickness throughout paving process. By keeping track of the spreadrates and performing dipchecks behind the paver.
Frequency - For each truckload that gets paved, 1 mix tracking sheet per shift and a site diagram per layer
Inspection / Test method - Survey, Field / Lab Testing
Acceptance Criteria - a minimum of 90% specified layer thickness to be achieved, but maximum minus 10mm of Specified layer thickness from design, with a minimum of 80mm per layer for AC20 PG64V.
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 2020: 9.7 and table 3.1
Verification Record Documents - Mix tracking sheet and site diagram in QA pack and photographic evidence to prove dipchecks have been performed
Comments/ Verification - These are deemed operational checks and will get verified through cores as specified in items 3.3.6 and 3.4.6
Detail of Activity - Plateau testing to be performed to set rolling pattern
Inspection / Test method - Field / Lab Testing
Verification Record Documents - Asphalt plateau density test sheet from QA pack
Detail of Activity - Monitor compaction throughout paving process for quality control by the use of a NDM gauge
Frequency - Minimum of 1 test per 20 linear meters per run and minimum 1 every 100m on Longitudinal Joints
Inspection / Test method - Field / Lab Testing

Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt shall be uniformly compacted to the standards specified in clause 9.9.1 as soon as the asphalt has cooled sufficiently to support the compaction equipment without undue displacement.
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 9.9.1 - 9.9.2
Verification Record Documents - NDM sheet in QA pack
Responsibilities - Super Site Engineer, Foreman, PS QA
Comments/ Verification - These are operational quality control checks and will be formally verified through cores as specified in items 3.3.5 .

As the Deeplift on this site is less than 30T it does not count as a lot and therefore no AC20 cores are required as per M10. If there is any concearn for the AC20 having failed, contact manager prior to continue paving surface layer. To get additional instruction on whether or not to continue or postpone
Detail of Activity - Delivery and compaction temperatures to be monitored throughout the paving process
Frequency - Each truckload that arrives on site prior to paving
Inspection / Test method - Field / Lab Testing
Acceptance Criteria - A minimum of -30 degrees from the recommended mixing temperature of 155-170°C To be recorded when mix is tipped into the paver.
○ Manager to be notified if temperature falls below: SMA12.5 PG64V 125°C
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 2020: M27 Notes; Higgins asphalt bitumen guide, NZTA M1A 2019
Verification Record Documents - Mix tracking sheet from QA pack; contains delivery temperature, temp when in paver, temp inside the screed and rolling temp on AC
Comments/ Verification - It is critical to ensure a temperature representative of the full load and not surface temperatures of the mix are measured.
Detail of Activity - Monitor layer thickness throughout paving process. By keeping track of the spreadrates and performing dipchecks behind the paver.
Frequency - For each truckload that gets paved, 1 mix tracking sheet per shift and a site diagram per layer
Inspection / Test method - Survey, Field / Lab Testing
Acceptance Criteria - Average depth > min specified depth
○ As per M10 for layer thicknesses below spec. an LCV of -5mm of specified thickness is allowed.
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 2020: 9.7 and table 3.1; M27
Verification Record Documents - Layer sheet and site diagram in QA pack and photographic evidence to prove dipchecks have been performed
Comments/ Verification - These are deemed operational checks and will get verified through cores as specified in items 3.3.6 and 3.4.6
Detail of Activity - Plateau testing to be performed to set rolling pattern
Inspection / Test method - Field / Lab Testing
Verification Record Documents - Asphalt plateau density test sheet from QA pack
Detail of Activity - Monitor compaction throughout paving process for quality control by the use of a NDM gauge
Frequency - Joint: 1 per 100m /minimum. 3 per Lot Mat: 1 per 300m2 / minimum. 8 per Lot
Inspection / Test method - Field / Lab Testing

Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt shall be uniformly compacted to the standards specified in clause 9.9.1 as soon as the asphalt has cooled sufficiently to support the compaction equipment without undue displacement.
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 9.9.1 - 9.9.2 M27
Verification Record Documents - NDM sheet in QA pack
Responsibilities - Super Site Engineer, Foreman, PS QA
Comments/ Verification - These are internal quality control checks and will be formally verified through cores as specified in items 3.4.5
Detail of Activity - Cores to be taken post construction to prove layer thickness and air voids.
Frequency - Joint: 1 per 100m /minimum. 3 per Lot Mat: 1 per 300m2 / minimum. 8 per Lot
Inspection / Test method - Field / Lab Testing
Acceptance Criteria - Layer thickness testing :4no. core thickness tests to be taken before trimming. with a picture of each measurement.
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10: 2020: 9.7, 9.9, 10.3 M27
Verification Record Documents - IANZ Accredited Test Report
○ Coring Site Diagram in AC QA Pack
Responsibilities - Site Engineer, QA Foreman, Paving Supervisor
Detail of Activity - Joints between new asphalt and existing surfacings are to be over banded with a suitable bituminous filler to prevent water ingress.
Frequency - Between Joints of Existing and new Asphalt
Verification Record Documents - Mention quantities of Bandage Seal in AC QA Pack
○ Pictures uploaded into Site Diary of Procore
Detail of Activity - Ensure the shape and levels of finished surface is acceptable
Inspection / Test method - visual verification/ field testing

Acceptance Criteria - Roughness - Where the length of the site or the geometry is such that a road roughness-measuring vehicle cannot be used then the straight edge can be used for checking the surface shape.
○ Not more than 5mm under a 3m Straight Edge.
○ Where there is Kerb and Channel shall be flush with or no more than 5mm above the LOC.
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10 9.8 and M27 10.2
Verification Record Documents - Pictures and completion checklist
Frequency - For each site on the project
Acceptance Criteria - Over milled and Deep lift extents recorded and verified by Contract Engineer / QA
○ Spray sheets for membrane area received by Contract Engineer from Sealing Team.
○ Surfacing layer extents recorded and verified by Contract Engineer.
Specification/ Contract Clause Reference - NZTA M10, M27 as appropriate and contract drawings
Verification Record Documents - Evidence provided demonstrating full compliance with specified design
Responsibilities - QA Site Engineer, PE, RM
4.4 - Linemarking and RRPM reinstated - Matches previous linemarking - within 48 hours of sealing
Detail of Activity - On completion of surfacing pavement markings and reflective raised pavement markers are to be reinstated
Verification Record Documents - Pictures for verification
Detail of Activity - RAMM update to be completed
Client Final Inspection: The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in conformance with the contract requirements and and other relevant specifications.
